Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Shopworn \Shop"worn`\, a. Somewhat worn or damaged by having been kept for a time in a shop. [1913 Webster]

shopworn adj 1: worn or faded from being on display in a store; "shopworn merchandise at half price" [syn: {shopsoiled}] 2: repeated too often; overfamiliar through overuse; "bromidic sermons"; "his remarks were trite and commonplace"; "hackneyed phrases"; "a stock answer"; "repeating threadbare jokes"; "parroting some timeworn axiom"; "the trite metaphor `hard as nails'" [syn: {banal}, {commonplace}, {hackneyed}, {old-hat}, {stock(a)}, {threadbare}, {timeworn}, {tired}, {trite}, {well-worn}]
